skill.name: Build Diagnostics Agent - Deep Problem Solver
skill.description: **Purpose**: When Truth Layer finds a blocker, this agent investigates root cause and implements fix.

skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no code execution, file access, network calls, or external dependencies. Contains only structured troubleshooting guidelines for AI agents.

content.user_title: Diagnose build issues and find root causes
content.value_statement: Build failures waste hours of developer time. This agent systematically investigates blockers using all available tools, identifies the true root cause, and implements verified fixes without introducing new problems.
actual_capabilities: Reproduce errors exactly with full output capture
Gather context from configs, logs, and environment
Identify root cause vs symptoms in build failures
Research known issues via MCP and web search
Escalate when root cause cannot be determined
limitations: Cannot execute code directly - depends on available tools
Requires access to logs, configs, and error messages
Cannot make architectural decisions without human input
Only handles build and debugging related issues

use_cases.title: Fix build failures fast
use_cases.description: Diagnose cryptic build errors like Turbopack manifest issues or memory allocation failures with systematic investigation.

use_cases.title: Resolve CI/CD pipeline issues
use_cases.description: Investigate pipeline failures by reproducing errors, checking configurations, and identifying environment-related problems.

use_cases.title: Prevent recurring blockers
use_cases.description: Ensure fixes address root causes rather than symptoms, reducing repeat issues across the development team.

prompt_templates.title: Capture build error
prompt_templates.prompt: Build failed with: [paste error message]. Investigate this blocker. Reproduce the error, find the root cause, and propose a fix.

prompt_templates.title: Debug type errors
prompt_templates.prompt: TypeScript is reporting type mismatches in [file or component]. Run typecheck, examine the type definitions, identify the root cause, and suggest how to fix it.

prompt_templates.title: Investigate test failures
prompt_templates.prompt: Tests are failing in [module or test file]. Run the tests, examine the test structure, find why tests are failing, and implement a fix.

prompt_templates.title: Full diagnosis workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: We have a blocker: [description]. Follow your full investigation workflow. Reproduce the error, gather all context (configs, environment, related code), identify root cause with confidence level, propose solution with risk assessment, and verify the fix works.

output_examples.input: Build failed with: 'Error: Turbopack cannot write manifest to .next/static/turbopack/manifest.json'
output: ROOT CAUSE: Missing parent directory structure for Turbopack manifest output
SYMPTOM: File write error in Turbopack build
ACTUAL CAUSE: .next/static/turbopack/ directory does not exist before build
FIX: Add mkdir -p .next/static/turbopack/ before build or configure Turbopack output path
VALIDATION: Build completes without manifest write errors

best_practices: Reproduce the error exactly using the same conditions before attempting any fix
Gather comprehensive context from configs, logs, and environment before diagnosing
Report confidence levels and always verify fixes before claiming success
anti_patterns: Making changes without understanding the root cause
Trying random fixes until something appears to work
Assuming an error is unrelated to recent changes without evidence

faq.question: What build systems does this support?
faq.answer: Works with any build tool including npm, Turbopack, Vite, Webpack, TypeScript compiler, and CI/CD pipelines.

faq.question: How long does diagnosis typically take?
faq.answer: Simple issues resolve in minutes. Complex blockers may require 15-30 minutes of systematic investigation.

faq.question: Does this integrate with CI/CD tools?
faq.answer:: Yes, the agent can analyze CI/CD logs and errors from GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI, and similar platforms.

faq.question: Is my code or data accessed during diagnosis?
faq.answer: The agent only reads files you explicitly reference. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if the agent cannot find the root cause?
faq.answer: The agent follows stop criteria and escalates with a detailed investigation summary when root cause cannot be determined.

faq.question: How is this different from regular debugging?
faq.answer: This follows a structured investigation workflow with confidence levels, verification steps, and documented escalation paths.
